topic.title: Safe to use fitness tracker?
topic.body:
So for a while I've been considering grabbing one of those fancy ass fitness trackers to help me try and organise my workouts more effectively.
But So far it looks like our options are fitbit (now owned by google) or a plethora of chinese companies who are all equally shady as fuck.

For the security conscious among us. Is it possible to have such a device? Are there no reputable manufacturers who will not seek to fuck us?
Or are we forced to try and make one ourselves?

1565188740_1JpWZr3hPmL8cYSKQCzuqUyhG25Uu.body:
It'd be nice if 08chan wasn't a total mess.
Millchan is better but that isn't a high hurdle. 

It's weird adapting to this whacky torrent based distributed internet thing because its baffling how some sites work well while others don't and then it all shits itself at some point for no obvious reason.

1565346520_1CN9rdrWkKbk8EmDSQNZZrwGmd8Tv.body:
> [hdidnothingwrong](#comment_5_1LW31sbmLZebhhgTx2bhzeUNYbZ5cYnBfe):But if you are running it on a desktop 60GB is not a big deal.  Nowadays a 2TB hard disk is about $54, which means 60GB is less than $2 worth of storage.

I think the problem is more how long it would take to download. 60GB is only nothing if you're living in a major urban area with high speed internet.

> [fodase](#comment_20_16cMkqz45EzZSjYqk37UTVXaYqLLtrXf3r): Most of the edits on Wikipedia are made by corporations and governments. Here's an example :https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Congressional_staff_edits_to_Wikipedia [...]

I find that for scientific and technical subjects wikipedia is relatively reliable. 
And I suspect there will come a day when this information is restricted to the general public.

1565330250_18h7dSc5vXQNRA1sjyUmX7zaUTsFA.body:
I'll admit I'm not a good programmer or familiar with zeronet in any extensive capacity. But it seems to me that overall zeronet demands a lot in terms of resources that can make it hard to use for media heavy sites like say an imageboard. 
And some of the innate drawbacks of this seemingly torrent based network is that the system seems to shit itself when lots of people try to access something at once.

> [undisclosed](#comment_16_13QmjccZb92J1V7RpF8dkz4VQtJShJwuHK): Doing the lord's work anon.  Now if only I could get more than 0/5 peers with 08chan. 

I'd justbe happy with being able to post.

Also Kaffie I looked at that link. I just get a blank page with the MC logo and no boards.

> [kaffie](#comment_961_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Oh, whoops. I thought there was a default board. http://127.0.0.1:43110/13kifcv8J8noDEXdztXY4qkPPPKLK2PiAe is the default millchanhub board. [...]

So why use this instead of the other millchan? 
Considering that one is pretty much feature complete as is and works out the box with zero effort

> [kaffie](#comment_962_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): The big reason is that the boards are separated into hubs, meaning that the admin can't fuck you over by taking down the site or messing with your posts (each board would be ran by it's creator). Likewise you don't have to download boards/content you don't want to see. Whereas you have to by default with 08chan. Lastly, all of the images are stored as optional files, which can be spoilered/hidden behind a click, meaning you don't auto-dl images, keeping you safe from auto-dling/sharing stuff like CP. I wasn't even aware there were CP boards for the merger millchan, and only found out when I viewed it from a proxy (which has different boards dl'd). [...]

Ok so you explained why not to use 08chan. But why not millchan then?
So wait what is a merger site?

Honestly the idea of a lack of anonymity is concerning.
In many ways the chans have always pursued a goal of true anonymity. So with what I'm learning about zeronet, it seems it could be a step back for us. But one we may be unfortunately forced to take.

Ok so how do I add the other boards to this merger site? 
The links you provided seem to work but I'm unsure how to generate such things for other sites
Yeah doesn't seem to be auto adding them to the merger list. Though I do have the merger list now. This is a neat functionality overall if it is somewhat finicky

> [kaffie](#comment_973_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Try opening the sidebar and clicking reload/rebuild for the db?

Nope doesn't seem to do it. Tried another one of the links you posted and sure enough it did it. Dunno what you did with them but they seem to work perfectly.

> [kaffie](#comment_976_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Basically the merger site, if it's working properly, will pull in all sites of a particular category. In the zerohello site list you should see "Merged: Millchan" along with a list of sites under it. Those sites are what should be pulled in and appear on the site as boards. If it's not, something got messed up along the way. [...]

Yeah doesn't seem to want to pull them from me visiting the regular millchan site. 
But yeah I definitely see the advantages. 

When I visit the links you posted I get a blank page with this text in the top left:
"Please use Millchan Engine to browse profiles on this page. "
Then its added the merger site and my zerohello page.

But when I go to millchan itself and visit boards there it all functions normally without adding them to the merger.

> [kaffie](#comment_978_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): The millchan site should only show what boards you have downloaded. That's the entire point. I had thought there was a default board to start, but it seems not. [...]

Ok now I'm confused.
So whats this site?
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_884_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): This is Millchan. The site without merger feature. It is the site 08chan was clonned from and Millchan has more up to date code. The site with merger feature is called Millchan engine or Millchan merger. You will likely see no boards on MC Engine, because you need to first visit some board site (aka "hub"), you can find one when you click the link "Example hub" on this page where is MC engine introduced. The link is on the bottom of the first post. That Example hub will add new board to the Millchan engine site and inside the board you can find a topic with more boards and a guide how to setup your own discussion board.

Yeah I'd gotten that far. 
So can't add sites to the merger hub thing by visiting the non-merger millchan?

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_886_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Unsure if i understand. Browsing non-merger Millchan site will not add any hub to the Millchan Engine site. Only when you visit special zeronet site that is a Millchan Engine hub (or also called merger site), then i think you should be prompted whether you want to add it to the Millchan Engine. Once added, new board will appear in the list or Millchan Engine boards.

Ahhh there we go. All misconceptions cleared up now.
that you have millchan and millchan engine is quite confusing.

> [toyata](#comment_95_17mM4YqSx7nMkYcePZB2GWcJBzkogWpqA1): Is there any plan or willingness to try a merger based version of 08chan?I think many people would stand by to help in that case.

Some kind of merger site with a catalogue available on the front page so you can limit what you download would be the best way to go.

1565329400_194xi8BJsLXhwje1kBJETKo6tjvhH.body:
> [ayylmaolol](#comment_14_1E5GcuKhRw6sujdX3XKosJ54HFJ4pMtr14): btw. why do we even consider a surgery to change your physical body to be a treatment for a mental issue? This reminds me very strongly on how we used to cure schizophrenia with lobotomy and i personally think that in a few decades we will look back and we will be disgusted at about how we mutilated trannies. Spending hours per day dilating to keep your body from sealing the open wound that you call vagina.... for your whole life.... just because some political ideology was forcing it as progressive and tricked you into thinking that this would solve your mental issue.

Fun fact. A lot of the early pioneering work in this field was destroyed by the Nazis. Overall probably a good thing. 

But in general the reason it became pursued as a "solution" these days is because with a lot of mental illnesses there isn't a cure. Whether you focus on therapy like they do in Europe or drugs like they do in North America. Either way the actual goal is the same: Management of their condition. 
With psychiatry your goal is very rarely to cure their ailment but to make it something that is manageable, that they can live with. 

For some psychological abnormalities/mental illnesses this is very easy. For ones like homosexuality there isn't much needed at all aside from some education on how not to become a sexual typhoid mary. 
But for others especially the body identity ones? It gets a lot harder. There's not much you can do to address the discomfort an adult victim (child victims are almost always displaying this behaviour as a symptom of another problem) of these disorders has with their own body. No amount of therapy is really going to help and I've not heard of any drugs that alleviate it either, don't even want to imagine what mechanisms such a drug would work on. 
So for many years the only real solution was to encourage them to crossdress a bit in any avenue where it was appropriate (theatre was a popular one) 

So when surgical solutions were redeveloped there was a lot of excitement. As it presented an opportunity of a permanent fix to the problem. Humans love quick fixes. Its in our nature. 
Essentially in many ways it's similar the thalidomide problem. It presented remarkable results early on but on examination of later outcomes it paints a horrifying picture. 
Post op trannies have a shockingly higher suicide rate along with depression rate. Regret is a common theme among many. 

Another problem that may contribute to this is how many post op trannies essentially get dumped by the support networks that helped them get to where they are. 
Once you've undergone surgical intervention then thats it. You're done. You're expected to get along on your own as a woman now. Most of the advocacy groups and communities don't want anything more to do with you and certainly aren't interesting in you "poisoning" their communities by complaining about the outcomes of your surgery or asking questions.
So couple an extreme life change that has a lot of negative outcomes along with losing a large chunk of your social support network? Not pleasant. 

My earlier comparison to thalidomide was not coincidental as I feel that in the long run they will be compared in a similar fashion.
And at the same time I suspect they will both enjoy something of a resurgence in a more careful and targeted capacity, as thalidomide has recently experienced as a cancer and leprosy treatment.

> [r3naam3r](#comment_17_1Dssbq2y2JDD14aojGG9RX3d5EPpw6zQxM): Do you agree with such statement:"Yellow race has the best intellectual potential but worst physical, white race is in the middle, and the black race has best physical potential but worst intellectual".? [...]

Eh I'm an outright fascist too and I find these kind of claims somewhat dubious. 
Especially considering Asias shall we say less than stellar outcomes in regards to most nations.

> [kaffie](#comment_977_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Africans indeed seem to be the worst off in terms of orderly societies and revolutionary progress, but they definitely have the best physical potential.

Ehhh not really. Some specific parts of Africa do seem to consistently throw out people with traits that make them ideally suited for a particular sport. I recall reading a lot of the black sprinters can trace their lineage to a specific valley. 
But their heightened average physicality compared to whitey seems to have more to do with them being able to better shrug off the damage to testosterone production that so blights us in the developed world. And producing more of it to begin with (probable contributor to the heightened aggression)

You're spot on in regards to Asians though. A weird and pretty unique phenomena throughout Chinese military history is the immediate absorption of defeated armies into the victors. 
In our part of the world that sort of thing only happened post conflict or with efforts to recruit their leadership. Otherwise defeated armies would scatter or be wiped out.

> [aspidochelone](#comment_41_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsKABo1Z):  Letting them get free procedures in the military instead of disqualifying them for medical reasons was highly dubious, but giving everyone free health care by right would be ideal. 

Oh fuck no this is the right thing to do for the USA. You can't let the trannies in the military.
See in the USA once you join the military the US government takes on responsibility for your healthcare for life. 
And a trannie who transitions is a patient for life. 

So each one who joins the military represents a massive burden to the taxpayer. 
Whats more if they start offering the surgeries and hormones essentially free to them, you'll have trannies breaking down the doors to join the military. The costs would be quite horrific longterm as they would for a long time only ever go up.
And these aren't mentally stable people to begin with, so you probably don't want them near weapons.
As expected the trannies make everything about them and force us to focus on them ignoring more important topics.

1565968613_16GG19wZtGAcebcKhf2hEmcf1sETi.body:
So would these cameras be fucked by IR LEDs?
I recall that being a good trick to deal with ubiquitous surveillance.

Used to be with old security cameras you could rig a few IR LEDs on your hat, crank em up and the camera would just see a white spot about your head/upper torso. 
Not tried this in years so unsure if it still works.

> [trevorlaneray](#comment_92_12eXcQ1ojAbyCoCcMQ3JAKi73wgcJrjow3): I'd go for nothing less than a full 360° array of LEDs to be safe.Thinking more on it, I wonder if the IR emission of the camera's own LEDs could be used against it by employing retroreflectors. Probably not... would be interesting to test.

Yeah used to have them fitted onto an american style baseball cap. Some around the rim and more on the fabric part of the hat itself.
Worked pretty well overall. 
But could only cover the head/upper torso area.

> [trevorlaneray](#comment_93_12eXcQ1ojAbyCoCcMQ3JAKi73wgcJrjow3): Hmm. There's an abundance of caps that have regular old LED lights on the rim for lighting the area in front of you at night... Could be easy to replace those LEDs with IR ones, and even add more, keeping most of the built-in circuitry, then upgrading the battery to power the array in parallel so as to handle the extra load. :D

Got a hat like that too. They tend to mount them under the brim of the hat making it a bit less useful in this context.
Ehhh de-authers are a legal grey area to some extent.
I think you're more likely to just see a new version of the wifi protocol that makes it impossible long before governments get around to legislating

Because the less formal and verified it becomes the more likely it is that you'll get people constantly assigning themselves the same domain name.

1566671185_1GFU4qAMTFnQJ7W7r98Zj2xJWq1ev.body:
So essentially most of this is about intellectual property rights and your desire to increase those for people who participate to free software projects.
Completely ignoring the fact that generally speaking these rights are easily circumvented by corporate entities. 
You said it yourself. The costs of litigation are prohibitive.

Many programmers do not have the intellectual property rights they think they do. Same is true of engineers and other such creative workers.
Most employment contracts for such workers explicitly stipulate that anything they produce (even out of hours) belongs to the company. So many of these free software projects could be claimed by one company or another in part or in whole.
But they don't because its not worth the effort.

1569605502_17xMbJPXvnaePZLbYtkWeAoznqRso.body:
Not likely.
Thomas Cooks death was more a product of its industry dying and the company failing to find ways to adapt. 
They were a high street package holiday retailer. Meaning they had to hire a lot of staff and maintain a lot of properties. 

However less people are buying package holidays these days. Instead they prefer to get them cheaper by arranging individual holiday elements themselves. 
That is of course if people are even going on holiday (which few are anymore due to a general global economic downturn and decades of stagnant wages)
Of those who still buy package holidays they're generally going online to get them cheaper (since online only providers don't have to pay much in the way of staff wages or property costs)

1570456755_1DXjRGbVDrJjUQd4ZzmFF1vvQUvqs.body:
Generally speaking theres a number of reasons.

First is that yes they have the CCP backing them and the USA is not keen to pick a fight there.
For the CCP the norks are a great buffer state between them and the US vassal state of south korea. 
If the USA wants to invade China their only option with a reasonable (though still low) chance of success is to do so through North Korea. But declaring war on one nation purely to use as a route to invade another is generally unpalatable to most and would make it very difficult for the USA to build the international coalition it would need to have any hope of successfully invading China.
Even if that other nation is the DPRK

Another reason is that the USA simply can't feasibly invade and hold North Korea. 
There's a number of factors at play here. Ranging from the terrain (entirely mountainous) and the local populace. 
The terrain would be difficult for the USA as they'd have to ditch a lot of their established gear and operational norms. 
The populace meanwhile would be the biggest problem. During the Korean war the USA went all out on the warcrimes. Mass executions of civilians, bombing everything that looked like a building with the USAF being publicly proud of there not being a single standing structure in all of North Korea, etc. And their government spares no expense remining the north korean people of this. 
So the Nork people do not like the yanks. Not even slightly. Literally zero sympathy or even empathy from them. 
As a consequence there'd be none of the mild hostility but general ambivalence of the middle east that US troops have to deal with. It would be outright hostility 24/7. Every single civilian would be resisting the US. 

And this is before we go into the consequences of a US/DPRK war for South Korea. Suffice to say the USAs own expectations are the total collapse of the South Korean republic and 10% of its total population dead in the first few hours.  
Longterm? The USA wouldn't be able to hold ground in North Korea. Simply by virtue of no longer being able to control South Korea as it descends into anarchy and chaos, with the Chinese encouraging it every step of the way.

As it has been described to me. It would be best to imagine a new Korean war as an eternal Afghanistan meets Vietnam where the USA can't reliably use aircraft.
That's pretty out there as theories go. Mainly because it assumes the USA rules the world.
Aside from that being a retarded power fantasy it's not remotely useful as this wouldn't end the DPRK.

As there was no intent to procure/view/own said material there is room to argue (in most civilised nations) innocence.

> [anonymouslogin](#comment_59_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92TaiY7X): Doubtful, besides the whole point of a distributed internet is to make censorship impossible. I don't personally agree with much of the content others provide, but I do believe that people have a right to say and post what they want to, and as a relay node I believe we have a duty to not filter the information flow. If you choose to provide content that is illegal where you live, and that content is discovered in your possession then you will have to face the consequences for that decision.

There have been a few cases involving TOR where those initially charged with distribution of child pornography were cleared of any wrongdoing. 
I think in any common law jurisdiction (UK/USA/CAN/AUS/NZ) these cases would be vital for your own defence and you would have to explain to police/courts the basic operating principles of zeronet. 
Could probably get you off.

1579517170_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body:
Basically Hollywood worked out a mathematical formula to apply to all movies to guarantee financial success.
It produces nothing but mediocre crap but it excites the dull minded and gets them to turn out in droves. It is also made to a length that is convenient but still encourages further purchases of consumable goods such as snacks which makes cinemas more likely to carry the movie. 

This formula is now applied to everything hollywood produces. This is why every hollywood movie is the same. 
TV series do sometimes get more leeway to do their own thing but generally they have their own genre specific formulae to follow
